R for Data Analysis Bootcamp

Department: Engineering Management and Systems Engineering @ GWU

Description:

This course provides a quick foundation in using the R programming language for data analytics. It is designed to be self-taught as preparation for other courses that build on the concepts covered. Topics include:

  • Data input/output
  • Data structures (vectors, data frames, lists)
  • Data wrangling
  • Data visualization
  • External packages
  • Reproducible reporting

Learning Objectives:

Having successfully completed this course, students will be able to:

  • Write clear, robust, and reasonably efficient code for working with data in R using vectors, data frames, and lists.
  • Reproducibly import, export, wrangle, and visualize data.

Prerequisites:

There are no prerequisites. Students are assumed to have zero prior programming experience for this course.
